str2: Contracted from Epaphroditos; Epaphras, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From agon; to struggle, literally, figuratively, or genitive case.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From telos; complete; neuter completeness.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pleres and phoreo; to carry out fully, i.e. Completely assure, entirely accomplish.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
